int Contour::processContour ( vec_d &  my_path_intervals  ) 

Fit splines to contour points in this contour.

Parameters:
[out] my_path_intervals Straight-line distance between successive spline samples.
Returns:
Expected number of spline samples based on contour spline lengths and minimum and maximum sample intervals.

References calcSampleIntervals(), getName(), Control_Points::getNumSplines(), Controls::getOutputDir(), Controls::getPrintDetailedInfo(), getSection(), Controls::instance(), Parameter::print(), and Parameter::reserve().

bool Contour::isDegenerate ( void   )  const

Determine if contour has too few samples to be a valid contour shape. Specifically, a contour with two or less points has zero circumscribing area and is an impossibly physiological shape.

Returns:
True if contour is degenerate; false otherwise.

References Parameter::getNumSamplePoints().

bool Contour::deviationsLarge ( void   )  [inline]

Check if any measured deviation of spline samples from linearly-connected raw contour points exceeds threshold.

Returns:
True if deviation threshold is exceeded; false otherwise.

bool Contour::fewButKeep ( void   )  [inline]

Check if contour has too few raw points to spline but sufficent number to pass threshold criterion.

Returns:
True if keep contour; false otherwise.

References getName(), getNumRawPoints(), Controls::getPtPerContourThreshold(), getSection(), and Controls::instance().

bool Contour::fewOmit ( void   )  [inline]

Check if contour has too few raw points to spline and an insufficent number to pass threshold criterion.

Returns:
True if omit contour; false otherwise.
